Prepare SNP input for PolyFun

Source: R/POLYFUN.R
POLYFUN.prepare_snp_input.Rd

PolyFun requires a space-delimited (gzipped or not) file with these columns:

  • CHR

  • BP

  • A1

  • A2

POLYFUN.prepare_snp_input(
  PF.output.path,
  locus_dir,
  finemap_dat = NULL,
  nThread = 1
)

See also

Other polyfun: POLYFUN.compute_priors(), POLYFUN.download_ref_files(), POLYFUN.find_polyfun_folder(), POLYFUN.finemapper(), POLYFUN.functional_enrichment(), POLYFUN.gather_annotations(), POLYFUN.gather_ldscores(), POLYFUN.get_precomputed_priors(), POLYFUN.h2_enrichment_SNPgroups_plot(), POLYFUN.h2_enrichment_SNPgroups(), POLYFUN.h2_enrichment(), POLYFUN.help(), POLYFUN.initialize(), POLYFUN.ldsc_annot_enrichment(), POLYFUN.munge_summ_stats(), POLYFUN.plot(), POLYFUN.read_parquet(), POLYFUN.run_ldsc(), POLYFUN_SUSIE()

Examples

data("BST1"); data("locus_dir");
finemap_dat <- BST1
PF.output.path <- file.path(locus_dir, "PolyFun")
POLYFUN.prepare_snp_input(PF.output.path=PF.output.path, locus_dir=locus_dir, finemap_dat=finemap_dat)

#> [1] "PolyFun:: Preparing SNP input file..."
#> [1] "+ PolyFun:: 6216 SNPs identified."
#> [1] "+ PolyFun:: Writing SNP file ==> results/GWAS/Nalls23andMe_2019/BST1/PolyFun/snps_to_finemap.txt.gz"
#> [1] "results/GWAS/Nalls23andMe_2019/BST1/PolyFun/snps_to_finemap.txt.gz"
